title: Basics of Lean Six Sigma: Green Belt
headline: Discover all you need to know about Lean Six Sigma Green Belt fundamentals with this free online course.
description: Every business has a continuous improvement culture that aims to improve daily. In this course, we will explore the basics of the Lean Six Sigma Green Belt and how to use its principles and tools to reduce waste and speed up processes in your organization. We will use real-world examples to explore the statistical, organizational and productive concepts within Lean Lean Six Sigma Green Belt projects. Sign up today and start learning.
courseDescription:
As businesses worldwide strive to enhance their operational efficiency and provide consumers with high-quality products and services, gaining a comprehensive understanding of Lean Six Sigma Green Belt principles is crucial to keeping up with the continuous improvement culture. The introductory section will provide an in-depth overview of the Six Sigma and Lean methodologies, a detailed historical narrative of their development and examples from real-world situations. You will also study why Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certification is critical.

Next, you will gain a profound grasp of the Lean Six Sigma design processes like the ‘Define, Measure, Analyze, Design and verify’ (DMADV) approach that makes sure new products fulfill customer needs and then explore the ‘Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve and Control’ DMAIC methodology of Lean Six Sigma and its applications. You will also examine critical Lean Six Sigma statistical concepts and tools for data collection, such as the concept of metrics, the standard normal distribution curve and the Pareto chart. Furthermore, you will explore the ‘5 Ss’ of organizing your workplace, the Kanban manufacturing system and their origins.

Moreover, we will discuss essential Lean Six Sigma quality and production concepts such as total productive maintenance, quality implementation and continuous improvement (Kaizen). Lastly, you will learn how to lead and control Lean Six Sigma projects, apply Lean Six Sigma to services and retain your customers. This course is published by Stone River eLearning. With over 1.3 million registered students, they are trusted to provide quality training for job roles, workplace skills and more. So do not hesitate to enroll in this course today!

• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module, you will be able to:
    • Solve problems through the DMAIC principles of lean six sigma
    • Identify statistical concepts used in lean six sigma projects
    • Discuss how to manage and lead lean six sigma projects successfully
    • Explain the role and responsibilities of lean six sigma green belt
    • Summarize how to use lean six sigma to gain operational efficiency within an organization

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
  • The whole idea of six sigma is to provide reliable, consistent and dependable products to customers, and the process focuses on defects, variability and the customer.
  • Lean is defined as the elimination of all non-value added activities or 'waste'. The goal of lean is to find the areas of waste and permanently eliminate them.
  • Six sigma green belt are experts in identifying problems, analyzing data and creating solutions to lower costs while improving quality.
  • The following are some of the responsibilities of a six sigma green belt:
    1. Selecting the team members for the project.
    2. Communicating with stakeholders throughout all stages of the project.
    3. Facilitating the team through all phases of the project.
    4. Scheduling meetings and coordinating logistics.
    5. Analyzing data through all phases of the project.
  • DMADV (define, measure, analyze, design and verify) is a six sigma framework that focuses primarily on developing a new service, product or process instead of improving a previously existing one.
